cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 455 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the east-central Gulf, then turning northeast toward the Florida Panhandle and inland across the south-eastern U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle / Big Bend coast (near Panama City – Apalachicola)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mississippi/Alabama border westward to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Pascagoula
weather_observation.warning_coast: none for Mississippi coast; hurricane & surge warnings confined east of Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: eastern Louisiana through Mississippi and Alabama coasts subject to outer rain bands and modest surge; primary impact zone Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands could bring sustained 25–35 kt (30–40 mph) winds with higher gusts late Tue night through Wed evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 2–3 ft possible on open coast and in bays; less inside the port’s protected channel
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches possible in bands; flash-flood risk low
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls causing sudden wind shifts and reduced visibility; elevated seas and rip currents along approaches
